result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy G. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $50 per month starting September 1, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Sentence to start on or before July 31, 2015 at 6:00 P.M.  EMP allowed according to jail rules.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of copy of commitment order.     Return to Sender.  Attempted Not Known.    Unable to Forward.

Defendant plead no contest to the charge.  Court advised the charge and possible penalties.  Court reviewed plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court confirmed that the defendant wished to continue without counsel.  Defendant stipulated to a factual basis.  Court found that the defendant entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court finds that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged.  State recommended probation.  Conditions:  the defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  In the alternative,  20 days jail.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Defendant does not want probation.  Requests huber.  Court ordered:  20 days jail.  Start on or before July 31, 2015 6 pm. Stay conditioned on not violating any laws.  EMP allowed according to jail rules.  CC  pay @ 50/mo 9/1/15.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  State offered probation or 20 days jail.  Defendant given plea questionnaire to complete.
Plea hearing at 07-20-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant appeared without counsel.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant still wishes to proceed without an attorney.  He states he can't do probation as he's trying to start a business.  DA is to give the defendant an offer and defendant is to notify DA by Friday of this week if accepts and set for plea or jury trial.  DA Fox gave defendant a written offer in court.
Status conference at 06-15-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Defendant stated that he called the DA's office for the pre-trial, but never received a call back.  Defendant to stay and talk to ADA Inlow after court.

Status conference at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 04-22-2015 10:00 am.
Court asked defendant how is wished to plead.  NG.  NGP entered by court.  PTC & STC dates set.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Defendant filled out Waiver of Right to Attorney form, and wishes to proceed without an attorney.  Court questioned defendant on the waiver, advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Court found defendant waived his right to counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-30-2015 09:30 am

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Court questions why FTA this AM?  Defendant did not have an excuse.  DA Fox requested that bond forfeiture be vacated.  Court granted, Bond reinstated.  Defendant has been denied by SPD & Court.  Defendant given right to attorney and waiver form to fill out and bring with him at AIA on 3/30/15.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant FTA for AIA.  Court ordered signature bond converted.

order denying court appointed attorney.

Defendant appeared without counsel.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  DA states this is his 3rd adjourned initial appearance.  Defendant states he filed his Petition for Counsel this morning in the Clerk of Court's Office.  Court set adjourned initial appearance for 3-23-15 at 9:30 and advised defendant to call the Clerk of Court's office by Friday to find out status of Petition for Counsel.
Sent to Judge for review
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance at 03-09-2015 09:30 am

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant did not qualify for SPD representation.  Defendant will fill out request for court appointed attorney forms.  AIA set for 3/9/15.
WSPD eligibility form.  Defendant is not eligible for SPD representation.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person.  Warrant quashed.  Bond reinstated.  Defendant has not contacted SPD.  He did contact Attorney Osborne.  Court advised defendant to contact SPD.
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-23-2015 09:30 am
